result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A. Ulatowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs/Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 3/1/2016 or penalty of 2 days Huber consecutive for non-payment.
09/21/2016 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FOR COMMUNITY SERVICE IN LIEU OF BALANCE OF COSTS. DEFENDANT TO SEND PROOF OF COMPLETION. TO SERVE 31 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE. TO BE COMPLETED BY 04/01/2017. 
DUE DATE CORRECTED TO 04/01/17
Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by Noon on 2/15/2016.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Craig A. Ulatowski in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner as a friend of the court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests additional time for the Defendant to complete the community service and advises the Court the Defendant has been residing in the State of Arizona.   The Court quashes the warrant and grants an extension to the end of July.
Bail/bond hearing on May 22, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Branch 9 Only.

Defendant Craig A. Ulatowski not in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not appear, case was set for 8:30 a.m. , case was called at 8:54 a.m.  Based on defendant's non appearance,  Court issues capias.
Review hearing on April 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.

From WCS dated 3/31/17 re defendant's failure to complete community service and fines are still outstanding.

From defendant received 9/15/16 requesting community service in leiu of remainder of balance owed.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 9/15/16; Granted.  Ordered to contact WCS and complete 30 hours of community service within 6 months in satisfaction of remaining court ordered obligations.
To defendant, request denied.
From defendant dated 3/14/16 requesting 2 days in Huber in lieu of payment of court obligations.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Craig A. Ulatowski in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1, repeater struck.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:
Sentence of:
20 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by Noon on 2/15/2016.  
COSTS:  $243.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 3/1/2016.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 2 days in Huber consecutive
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
